titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Julia Nunnally Duncan Collection of Fred Chappell Letters, 1988-1998 RL.11147
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-02-26 11:49:17 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Julia Nunnally Duncan collection of Fred Chappell letters
did.abstract: Collection consists of incoming correspondence (1988-1998) to Julia Nunnally Duncan from North Carolina poet and author Fred Chappell.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Julia Nunnally Duncan is a poet and fiction writer living in Marion, North Carolina. Fred Chappell is the former Poet Laureate for North Carolina (1997-2002), and taught English at the University of North Carolina at Greensboro for 40 years.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Julia Nunnally Duncan Collection of Fred Chappell Letters was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Julia Nunnally Duncan Collection of Fred Chappell Letters, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0205

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Please see the collection of Fred Chappell Papers, also held by the Rubenstein Library.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists largely of incoming typescript correspondence from Fred Chappell to Julia Nunnally Duncan, beginning with their initial introduction and evolving to a mentor/mentee relationship and friendship between two North Carolina writers. The letters demonstrate that Chappell took a personal interest in encouraging Duncan's writing and career, promoting her work to various publishers, agents, and other literary contacts. Chappell offers his opinions, comments, and edits about Duncan's work, and also writes about his own projects and travels, personal life and activities, and his thoughts on various authors, movies, concerts, and other miscellaneous topics. Only a few return letters from Duncan to Chappell are included.
